Join Our Product and Design Team

We are strengthening our product and design team at Prismatics. Explore the available opportunities below and become part of our journey to create impactful digital solutions.

Product Team Position

Reference No: PM32X

Location: Melbourne (Hybrid) | Salary: $95,000 – $110,000 p.a.

Reports to: Head of Product

Short Description

Our Product Team at Prismatics is the driving force behind transforming ideas into impactful digital solutions. Composed of strategic thinkers, problem solvers, and tech enthusiasts, the team takes ownership of the entire product lifecycle—from initial ideation and market research to launch and continuous improvement. They work closely with engineering, design, and business teams to define product roadmaps, set priorities, and ensure every product aligns with our mission to deliver value to our users. With a focus on innovation, user-centric decision-making, and agile methodologies, the Product Team is committed to turning challenges into opportunities and bringing meaningful products to life.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Define product roadmap and strategy.
  2. Coordinate between design, engineering, and business teams.
  3. Monitor progress and ensure timely delivery.

Requirements

  • Essential: Experience in Agile/Scrum, strong communication skills, proven product management track record.
  • Preferable: Background in IT/software development, leadership experience in startups.

Designer Team Position

Reference No: UX56B

Location: Hybrid | Salary: $75,000 – $85,000 p.a.

Reports to: Product Manager

Short Description

Our Design Team at Prismatics crafts engaging, intuitive, and accessible digital experiences that delight users and elevate our products. The team combines creativity with strategic thinking, producing everything from wireframes and prototypes to polished visual designs and comprehensive design systems. By conducting user research, usability testing, and iterative design processes, the team ensures that every interface is user-friendly, visually consistent, and aligned with our brand. Collaborating closely with product managers and developers, the Design Team helps shape the look, feel, and functionality of our products, making sure each digital experience is not only beautiful but also highly functional and inclusive.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Conduct user research and usability testing.
  2. Create wireframes, prototypes, and visual design systems.
  3. Collaborate with product managers and developers.

Requirements

  • Essential: Proficiency in Figma/Adobe XD, strong portfolio of projects, knowledge of accessibility standards.
  • Preferable: Experience with mobile app design and cross-functional collaboration.

Why Work at Prismatics?

  • Innovative and Impactful Work: At Prismatics, you’ll be part of a team that constantly pushes the boundaries of technology and design. Every project has the potential to make a real-world impact, helping businesses and users achieve their goals through innovative digital solutions. Your contributions will shape products that users love, and you’ll gain exposure to cutting-edge tools and methodologies while collaborating with a passionate, expert team.
  • Career Growth and Learning Opportunities: At Prismatics, your professional development comes first. From the start, you’ll be encouraged to take ownership of projects, expand your skills, and explore new ideas. Through mentorship, workshops, and cross-team collaboration, you’ll gain exposure to product, design, and engineering. Whether aiming for leadership or specialization, you’ll have the support and freedom to grow, innovate, and make a real impact.
  • Collaborative Team Culture: We foster transparency, respect, and teamwork. Cross-functional collaboration ensures every voice is heard, creating products that reflect diverse perspectives. Brainstorming sessions, design critiques, and agile workflows support knowledge-sharing and collective problem-solving.
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Maintain a healthy work-life balance with hybrid and remote options. Flexibility allows creativity and efficiency to thrive, ensuring you can be productive while managing your personal life.
  • Inclusive and Growth-Oriented Environment: We value diversity in backgrounds and experiences, knowing it drives better ideas. Our culture encourages learning from mistakes, celebrating successes, and continuously improving processes. Employees are supported with resources for both personal and professional growth, fostering a sense of belonging and long-term commitment.
